biography_text: TIMMONS, William, a Representative from South Carolina; born in Greenville, Greenville County, S.C., April 30, 1984; graduated from Christ Church Episcopal School, Greenville, S.C., 2002; B.A., The George Washington University, Washington, D.C., 2006; M.S., University of South Carolina, Columbia, S.C., 2009; J.D., University of South Carolina, Columbia, S.C., 2010; United States Navy, 2002; South Carolina Army National Guard, 2018-present; lawyer; businessman; staff, United States Senator William H. Frist of Tennessee, 2006-2007; member of South Carolina state senate, 2016-2019; elected as a Republican to the One Hundred Sixteenth Congress (January 3, 2019-present).

post_secondary_degrees.institution: The George Washington University, Washington, D.C.
University of South Carolina, Columbia, S.C.
